input:
Sophia is a biologist with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 13), my wife (birthday on September 19), my child_1 (birthday on September 06), my father (birthday on July 27), my mother (birthday on June 05), 
2) Attending a fashion week in Paris in week 24-25.

3) Attend a parenting workshop every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 13.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Sophia for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

checks_range.24: Attending a fashion week in Paris

Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. Emma is a photographer with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 11), my wife (birthday on March 02), my child_1 (birthday on September 11), my father (birthday on August 19), my mother (birthday on August 30), 
2) Participating in a week-long sailing school in week 26-27.

3) Participate in a kite flying club every 3 weeks on weekends, starting from week 11.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Emma for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

Olivia is a architect with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on July 04), my wife (birthday on March 28), my child_1 (birthday on December 09), my father (birthday on June 07), my mother (birthday on May 09), 
2) Exploring the ancient temples of Cambodia in week 15-16.

3) Attend a jazz music appreciation club every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 10.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Olivia for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

input:
Noah is a photographer with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on March 08), my wife (birthday on July 09), my child_1 (birthday on November 06), my child_2 (birthday on August 31), my child_3 (birthday on November 17), 
2) Joining a fitness and wellness retreat in Bali in week 6-7.

3) Join a local running club for weekend marathons every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 10.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Noah for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. 
 Floor 2:
This floor provides a seamless transition from the lobby area by expanding the reception services while incorporating additional facilities to ensure a smooth start to the day for the building's occupants. Key elements include: 1) Expanded Reception: The reception area is extended to include a smaller meeting space, allowing staff to conduct brief meetings with visitors or other employees. 2) Café Area: A modern coffee bar with a sleek design offers a variety of hot and cold beverages, as well as light snacks. 3) Mailroom and Parcel Services: Dedicated area for handling and distribution of mail and packages for the building’s tenants. 
 Floor 3:
The advanced technology and research institute occupies this floor, marked by a significant emphasis on the integration of innovative systems and design elements. 1) State-of-the-art Equipment: The facility is equipped with cutting-edge research and testing equipment, facilitating the pursuit of groundbreaking research. 2) Collaborative Workspaces: Modular workstations are strategically arranged to foster collaboration among researchers, featuring integrated technology for seamless data sharing. 3) Breakout Areas: Spacious, well-lit breakout areas offer quiet spaces for individual focus and creative thinking.
 Floor 4:
On this floor, the research institute expands its scope by introducing specialized laboratories and testing facilities tailored to various scientific disciplines. 1) Advanced Lab Equipment: High-tech laboratory equipment supports a wide range of scientific experiments and analysis. 2) Specialized Laboratory Areas: Each laboratory is designed to accommodate specific research requirements, incorporating optimal environmental conditions and specialized equipment. 3) Project Meeting Rooms: Purpose-built rooms facilitate the organization, planning, and review of ongoing research projects.
 Floor 5:
A key feature of this floor is the incorporation of energy-efficient and sustainable design elements, reflecting the institute's commitment to environmental responsibility. 1) Natural Lighting and Ventilation: Strategically placed skylights and a naturally ventilated system enhance indoor air quality and reduce the need for artificial lighting. 2) High-Efficiency Systems: The installation of advanced energy-efficient systems for heating, cooling, and water management minimizes the building's carbon footprint. 3) Public Art Installation: A floor-to-ceiling public art installation made of reclaimed materials not only adds aesthetic appeal but also serves as a statement of the building's commitment to sustainability.
 Floor 6:
This floor focuses on the development and integration of innovative technologies into the research facility. 1) Virtual Reality Training Facilities: Virtual reality stations offer immersive training experiences for researchers and students, simulating real-world scenarios and enhancing knowledge retention. 2) Augmented Reality Displays: Strategically located augmented reality displays facilitate data visualization and interactive exploration of complex scientific concepts. 3) Smart Furniture: Ergonomic, smart furniture equipped with sensors and monitoring systems adapts to the needs of occupants, ensuring optimal comfort and productivity.
 Floor 7:
Dedicated to the storage and preservation of critical research data, this floor incorporates advanced data management and security systems. 1) High-Security Data Storage: State-of-the-art storage solutions ensure the secure and reliable storage of sensitive research data. 2) Data Analytics and Visualization: Advanced data analytics software and visual tools enable researchers to identify trends and connections within their data. 3) Digital Archives: A secure digital archive preserves research records and publications for future reference and collaboration.
 Floor 8:
This floor hosts a comprehensive library and resource center, providing researchers with access to a vast array of scientific literature and digital resources. 1) Comprehensive Library: A modern, well-stocked library houses a vast collection of scientific texts, journals, and online resources. 2) Collaborative Study Spaces: Ample study spaces accommodate both individual study and group work, featuring integrated technology and multimedia capabilities. 3) Research Assistants: Skilled research assistants are available to assist in literature searches, provide guidance on research methodologies, and facilitate access to specialized databases.
 Floor 9:
This floor includes an auditorium for seminars, workshops, and presentations, as well as a lecture hall for lectures and guest speakers. 1) Auditorium: A spacious, tiered auditorium with advanced audiovisual systems hosts conferences, seminars, and workshops. 2) Lecture Hall: A dedicated lecture hall offers a versatile space for lectures, panel discussions, and presentations. 3) Meeting and Breakout Rooms: A range of meeting and breakout rooms are available for smaller group discussions and planning sessions.
 Floor 10:
This floor offers additional office space for research institute staff, supporting the expansion of research efforts. 1) Modular Office Spaces: Flexible office layouts accommodate changing research priorities, ensuring that space is efficiently utilized. 2) Collaborative Workstations: Shared workspaces foster collaboration and creativity among researchers. 3) Breakout Areas: Designated areas for relaxation and rejuvenation provide a much-needed respite from intense research activities.
 Floor 11:
Occupied by administrative staff, this floor ensures the smooth operation of the research institute. 1) Administrative Offices: Spacious, well-appointed offices for the institute's administrative staff. 2) Human Resources: A dedicated area for HR functions, including recruitment, training, and benefits management. 3) IT Support: A team of IT specialists provides technical assistance and infrastructure support to research teams.
 Floor 12:
This floor houses the institute's finance and accounting departments, ensuring the effective management of research grants and budgets. 1) Finance Offices: A dedicated space for the institute's finance team, handling budget planning, grant management, and financial reporting. 2) Accounting Services: A team of experienced accountants provides financial management, forecasting, and auditing services. 3) Financial Planning and Budgeting: Regular financial planning and budgeting sessions facilitate strategic decision-making.
 Floor 13:
A floor dedicated to the support services of the research institute, providing essential facilities for staff and visitors. 1) Staff Wellness Center: A dedicated area offering wellness services, including fitness classes, massage therapy, and counseling. 2) Visitor Accommodations: Comfortable guest rooms for visiting researchers and industry partners. 3) Conference and Event Spaces: Flexible spaces for conferences, workshops, and networking events.

input:
Noah is a chef with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on July 22), my wife (birthday on September 03), my child_1 (birthday on March 21), my father (birthday on February 16), my mother (birthday on February 04), 
2) Week-long road trip across the Pacific Coast Highway in week 27-28.

3) Join a historical walking tour of the city every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 14.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Noah for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

input:
Benjamin is a chef with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on July 03), my wife (birthday on December 20), my child_1 (birthday on November 30), my child_2 (birthday on September 29), my child_3 (birthday on January 15), 
2) Participating in a desert trek in Morocco in week 51-52.

3) Explore new cafes and restaurants every 3 weeks on weekends, starting from week 10.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Benjamin for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

input:
Benjamin is a architect with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 14), my wife (birthday on January 19), my child_1 (birthday on January 01), my child_2 (birthday on March 16), my father (birthday on December 06), 
2) Joining a fitness and wellness retreat in Bali in week 32-33.

3) Attend DIY home improvement workshops every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 15.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Benjamin for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.
 Floor 2-4: 
These floors comprise the primary corridors, providing easy access to the various parts of the skyscraper. They are designed with functionality and ease of navigation in mind. Key features include:
- Polished hardwood flooring, ensuring a smooth and elegant surface underfoot
- Strategically placed glass partitions offer a seamless view into the adjacent spaces
- Soft, ambient lighting creates an inviting atmosphere
- Each floor has ample signage, ensuring visitors and employees can easily locate specific destinations
These corridors provide a seamless transition between the different areas of the skyscraper, while maintaining a sense of calm and sophistication.

 Floor 5-9: 
These floors house the skyscraper's primary meeting areas, carefully designed to accommodate a range of requirements from small, intimate gatherings to larger, more formal presentations. Features include:
- Modular meeting rooms with sleek, minimalist design
- State-of-the-art audio-visual equipment and presentation technology
- Spacious breakout rooms for networking and collaboration
- Elegant refreshment stations, providing an array of beverages and snacks

William is a engineer with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on November 30), my wife (birthday on January 25), my child_1 (birthday on February 07), my child_2 (birthday on October 02), my father (birthday on February 18), 
2) Attending a traditional dance festival in India in week 39-40.

3) Participate in a photography club every 3 weeks on weekends, starting from week 18.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for William for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

Noah is a historian with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on March 06), my wife (birthday on April 09), my child_1 (birthday on December 27), my child_2 (birthday on January 23), my father (birthday on February 13), 
2) Wildlife safari in Yellowstone National Park in week 17-18.

3) Participate in a language exchange meetup every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 13.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Noah for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

James is a photographer with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 17), my wife (birthday on March 12), my child_1 (birthday on April 06), my child_2 (birthday on December 13), my father (birthday on January 04), 
2) Participating in a week-long film production workshop in week 34-35.

3) Volunteer at the animal shelter every 4 weeks on weekends, starting from week 19.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for James for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

Floor 1: Entry Lobby
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. 
 Floor 2: Stairwell
The second floor is primarily dedicated to a spacious, well-ventilated stairwell that leads to higher floors. This ensures safe and convenient movement between levels. 1) Balustrades and Railings: Durable steel balustrades adorn the stairwell, complemented by gleaming glass railings that offer a panoramic view of the surroundings. 2) Lighting: Strategically placed LED lights illuminate the stairwell, creating a seamless, continuous line of illumination that enhances safety. 3) Landings: Generous landings between flights of stairs provide ample space for rest, allowing users to catch their breath.
 Floor 3: Service Corridor
The third floor serves as a dedicated service corridor that facilitates the movement of service personnel, deliveries, and maintenance staff. 1) Service Elevators: Two service elevators serve the corridor, enabling swift transportation of staff and goods. 2) Storage Areas: Strategically placed storage areas provide ample space for maintenance supplies, cleaning materials, and other essentials. 3) Safety Features: The corridor is equipped with emergency lights, exit signs, and push bars for easy access.
 Floor 4: Maintenance Access
The fourth floor is designed for easy access to critical systems and services. 1) Utility Tunnels: The floor houses various utility tunnels, housing conduits for power, data, and water supply lines. 2) Access Panels: Clearly marked access panels provide easy access for maintenance staff to perform repairs and inspections. 3) Emergency Shut-Off: An emergency shut-off valve is located on this floor for immediate control over essential services.
 Floor 5: Elevator Machine Room
This floor is dedicated to housing the elevator machine room, ensuring smooth and efficient elevator operations. 1) Equipment Room: A climate-controlled room houses the elevator control systems, motors, and other essential equipment. 2) Access Points: Secure access points allow authorized personnel to maintain and inspect elevator components. 3) Electrical Distribution: The room contains the electrical distribution panel, ensuring reliable power supply to elevators.
 Floor 6: Mechanical Room
The sixth floor serves as a mechanical room for the skyscraper. 1) HVAC Systems: The room houses the heating, ventilation, and air conditioning systems that regulate the building's temperature and air quality. 2) Electrical Distribution: The room contains the main electrical distribution panel, feeding power to various parts of the building. 3) Pumps and Motors: The room also houses pumps, generators, and other machinery that supports the building's mechanical operations.
 Floor 7: Electrical Room
This floor is dedicated to electrical infrastructure, housing critical electrical equipment. 1) Switchgear Rooms: Climate-controlled switchgear rooms house circuit breakers, relays, and other electrical apparatus. 2) Transformer Room: The room houses oil-filled transformers that step down electrical supply from high voltage to safe levels. 3) Lighting Control: A central lighting control room allows for precise control over lighting levels throughout the building.
 Floor 8: Fire Suppression Room
The eighth floor is dedicated to fire suppression systems and equipment. 1) Fire Pump Room: The room houses a fire pump that circulates water or other extinguishing agents through the fire suppression system. 2) Chemical Storage: Secure storage areas hold fire suppressants, chemicals, and other materials required for firefighting operations. 3) Alarm Panel: A central alarm panel monitors fire detectors and alert systems throughout the building.
 Floor 9: Vertical Transportation
The ninth floor features a vertical transportation system, facilitating efficient movement between floors. 1) High-Speed Elevators: Three high-speed elevators, capable of traveling up to 35 floors per minute, serve the building. 2) Stairwell Connection: A dedicated stairwell connects this floor to the service corridor below. 3) Emergency Evacuation: A backup emergency evacuation route is also provided for added safety.
 Floor 10: Safety Features
The tenth floor emphasizes safety features critical to building operations. 1) Fire Exit Stair: A dedicated fire exit stair connects this floor to the exterior, enabling safe egress in emergencies. 2) Safety Monitoring: This floor is equipped with advanced safety monitoring systems, tracking temperature, humidity, and air quality levels. 3) Emergency Lighting: Strategically placed emergency lights and exit signs illuminate escape routes.

input:
Benjamin is a journalist with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on September 05), my wife (birthday on October 23), my child_1 (birthday on January 08), my child_2 (birthday on April 16), my father (birthday on August 25), 
2) Exploring the castles of Scotland in week 19-20.

3) Join a weekend hiking group every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 12.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Benjamin for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.

James is a nurse with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on August 20), my wife (birthday on September 18), my child_1 (birthday on October 28), my child_2 (birthday on April 08), my father (birthday on April 05), 
2) Participating in a pottery and ceramics workshop in Japan in week 32-33.

3) Visit historic sites in the area every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 19.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for James for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. 
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
As we settle into the new year, we introduce flavors from the Mediterranean. 
Appetizers: 
1.1) Grilled Octopus: Char-grilled octopus, served with a zesty lemon and garlic sauce. 
1.2) Spicy Tuna Poke: Fresh tuna marinated in a zesty mixture of soy sauce, wasabi, and sesame oil, served with crispy wonton chips. 
Main Courses: 
2.1) Rack of Lamb with Lemon-Herb Sauce: A tender rack of lamb, served with a bright and citrusy lemon-herb sauce. 
2.2) Pan-Seared Salmon with Feta: Pan-seared salmon, topped with crumbled feta cheese, fresh dill, and a drizzle of olive oil. 
Side Dishes: 
3.1) Greek Salad: A classic Greek salad, featuring juicy tomatoes, crumbled feta cheese, olives, and a drizzle of extra virgin olive oil. 
3.2) Roasted Asparagus: Fresh asparagus roasted with olive oil, salt, and pepper, served with a sprinkle of parmesan cheese. 
Desserts: 
4.1) Baklava: Layers of crispy phyllo dough, nuts, and honey, drizzled with a sprinkle of cinnamon. 
4.2) Lemon Panna Cotta: A creamy lemon panna cotta topped with a sprinkle of sugar and a few fresh mint leaves. 
Drinks: 
5.1) Ouzo Spritz: A refreshing spritz made with ouzo, lemon-lime soda, and a splash of orange juice, served over ice with a sprig of rosemary. 
5.2) Greek Wines: A selection of Greek wines, including whites, reds, and rosés, curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
This week, we celebrate the art of comfort food with a focus on hearty, warming dishes. 
Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Tomato Soup: A rich and creamy soup made with fresh tomatoes, onions, and herbs, served with a swirl of creme fraiche. 
1.2) Pan-Seared Scallops with Garlic Butter: Scallops seared to perfection and served with a compound garlic butter, lemon wedges, and crispy prosciutto. 
Main Courses: 
2.1) Beef Bourguignon: A classic French beef stew cooked in red wine with mushrooms, onions, and herbs, served with crusty bread. 
2.2) Chicken Cordon Bleu: Chicken breast stuffed with ham, Swiss cheese, and herbs, then pan-seared and served with a side of garlic mashed potatoes. 
Side Dishes: 
3.1) Sautéed Spinach: Fresh spinach sautéed with garlic and lemon juice, served with a sprinkle of red pepper flakes. 
3.2) Roasted Sweet Potatoes: Sweet potatoes roasted with olive oil, salt, and pepper, served with a sprinkle of brown sugar. 
Desserts: 
4.1) Apple Crisp: A warm and comforting apple crisp made with fresh apples, oatmeal, and brown sugar, topped with a crumble of butter and cinnamon. 
4.2) Cheesecake: A rich and creamy cheesecake with a graham cracker crust, topped with a drizzle of caramel and a sprinkle of cinnamon. 
Drinks: 
5.1) Hot Chocolate: A rich and creamy hot chocolate made with dark chocolate, milk, and a sprinkle of cinnamon. 
5.2) Whiskey on the Rocks: A selection of fine whiskeys served over ice with a splash of water. 
 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
This week, we focus on the flavors of Italy, with a focus on pasta, seafood, and rich sauces. 
Appetizers: 
1.1) Bruschetta: Toasted bread rubbed with garlic and topped with diced tomatoes, basil, and mozzarella cheese, drizzled with extra virgin olive oil. 
1.2) Grilled Vegetable Skewers: Colorful vegetables grilled to perfection, served with a dollop of tzatziki sauce. 
Main Courses: 
2.1) Fettuccine Alfredo: Fettuccine pasta tossed in a rich and creamy Alfredo sauce, topped with parmesan cheese and a sprinkle of parsley. 
2.2) Cioppino: A hearty seafood stew from San Francisco, featuring clams, mussels, and shrimp, served with a side of crusty bread. 
Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic and Herb Roasted Broccoli: Fresh broccoli roasted with garlic, herbs, and lemon juice, served with a sprinkle of parmesan cheese. 
3.2) Sautéed Mushrooms: Mushrooms sautéed with garlic, herbs, and lemon juice, served with a sprinkle of thyme. 
Desserts: 
4.1) Tiramisu: A classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese, topped with cocoa powder. 
4.2) Cannoli: Crispy pastry shells filled with sweet ricotta cheese, chocolate chips, and candied fruit, served with a sprinkle of powdered sugar. 
Drinks: 
5.1) Pinot Grigio: A crisp and refreshing white wine from Italy, perfect for pairing with seafood and pasta dishes. 
5.2) Limoncello Spritz: A refreshing spritz made with limoncello, lemon-lime soda, and a splash of orange juice, served over ice with a sprig of rosemary. 
 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th): 
As we welcome the month of February, we introduce the flavors of Japan, with a focus on sushi, ramen, and steamed dishes. 
Appetizers: 
1.1) Edamame: Boiled edamame served with a side of soy sauce and sesame oil. 
1.2) Grilled Shrimp Skewers with Yuzu Sauce: Shrimp marinated in yuzu sauce and grilled to perfection, served with a side of steamed asparagus. 
Main Courses: 
2.1) Sushi Platter: A selection of fresh sushi rolls, including spicy tuna, salmon, and avocado, served with a side of wasabi and pickled ginger. 
2.2) Tonkatsu: A breaded and deep-fried pork cutlet served with a side of shredded cabbage and steamed rice. 
Side Dishes: 
3.1) Miso Soup: A traditional Japanese soup made with miso paste, tofu, and seaweed, served with a sprinkle of green onion. 
3.2) Steamed Bok Choy: Fresh bok choy steamed with soy sauce and sesame oil, served with a sprinkle of sesame seeds. 
Desserts: 
4.1) Mochi Ice Cream: A creamy ice cream sandwiched between soft mochi dough, served with a sprinkle of matcha powder. 
4.2) Matcha Tiramisu: A Japanese-inspired twist on the classic Italian dessert, featuring matcha-soaked ladyfingers and green tea-infused mascarpone cheese. 
Drinks: 
5.1) Sake: A selection of fine Japanese sake, perfect for pairing with sushi and steamed dishes. 
5.2) Green Tea Latte: A refreshing and soothing latte made with green tea and steamed milk, served over ice with a sprinkle of matcha powder. 
 Menu Week 6 (February 5th - February 11th): 
This week, we celebrate the flavors of France, with a focus on escargots, beef bourguignon, and crème brûlée. 
Appetizers: 
1.1) Escargots: Snails cooked in garlic butter and parsley, served with crusty bread for dipping. 
1.2) Foie Gras Torchon: Seared foie gras served with a side of pickled pink peppercorns and toasted baguette slices. 
Main Courses: 
2.1) Beef Bourguignon: A classic French stew made with braised beef, mushrooms, and onions, served with a side of crusty bread. 
2.2) Coq au Vin: Chicken cooked in red wine with mushrooms, onions, and bacon, served with a side of garlic mashed potatoes. 
Side Dishes: 
3.1) Sautéed Spinach: Fresh spinach sautéed with garlic and lemon juice, served with a sprinkle of red pepper flakes. 
3.2) Garlic and Herb Roasted Carrots: Fresh carrots roasted with garlic, herbs, and lemon juice, served with a sprinkle of parmesan cheese. 
Desserts: 
4.1) Crème Brûlée: A rich and creamy custard base topped with a layer of caramelized sugar, served with a side of fresh berries. 
4.2) Profiteroles: Cream-filled choux pastry balls served with a side of chocolate sauce for dipping. 
Drinks: 
5.1) Bordeaux Red: A full-bodied red wine from Bordeaux, perfect for pairing with beef bourguignon and coq au vin. 
5.2) Champagne Cocktail: A classic champagne cocktail made with champagne, cognac, and a splash of orange juice, served in a champagne flute. 
 Menu Week 7 (February 12th - February 18th): 
As we celebrate the midpoint of February, we introduce the flavors of Spain, with a focus on tapas, paella, and sangria. 
Appetizers: 
1.1) Patatas Bravas: Crispy fried potatoes served in a spicy tomato sauce, topped with a sprinkle of paprika. 
1.2) Grilled Shrimp Skewers with Romesco Sauce: Shrimp marinated in a smoky romesco sauce and grilled to perfection, served with a side of crusty bread. 
Main Courses: 
2.1) Paella Valenciana: A classic Spanish rice dish cooked with saffron, chorizo, and vegetables, served with a side of garlic bread. 
2.2) Pollo Al Ajillo: Chicken cooked in garlic and olive oil, served with a side of sautéed spinach and steamed asparagus. 
Side Dishes: 
3.1) Gazpacho: A cold soup made with tomatoes, cucumbers, and bell peppers, served with a side of crusty bread for dipping. 
3.2) Sautéed Artichoke Hearts: Artichoke hearts sautéed with garlic and lemon juice, served with a sprinkle of parsley. 
Desserts: 
4.1) Crema Catalana: A traditional Spanish custard dessert similar to crème brûlée, topped with a layer of caramelized sugar. 
4.2) Churros con Chocolate: Fried dough pastries coated in cinnamon sugar, served with a side of rich chocolate dipping sauce. 
Drinks: 
5.1) Rioja Red: A full-bodied red wine from Rioja, perfect for pairing with paella and pollo al ajillo. 
5.2) Sangria: A refreshing fruit punch made with red wine, fruit juices, and a splash of brandy, served over ice with a sprig of rosemary. 
 Menu Week 8 (February 19th - February 25th): 
This week, we celebrate the flavors of India, with a focus on curries, naan bread, and spicy sauces. 
Appetizers: 
1.1) Papadum: Thin, crispy flatbread served with a side of spiced chutney. 
1.2) Samosas: Crispy fried or baked pastries filled with spiced potatoes and peas, served with a side of raita. 
Main Courses: 
2.1) Chicken Tikka Masala: Chicken marinated in yogurt and spices, grilled and served in a rich tomato-based sauce, served with a side of basmati rice. 
2.2) Palak Paneer: A creamy spinach curry made with paneer cheese, spinach puree, and spices, served with a side of naan bread. 
Side Dishes: 
3.1) Basmati Rice: Fluffy basmati rice cooked with saffron and cardamom, served with a side of raita. 
3.2) Raita: A cool and creamy yogurt side dish flavored with cumin and coriander, served with a sprinkle of cucumber. 
Desserts: 
4.1) Gulab Jamun: Deep-fried dumplings soaked in a sweet and sticky syrup, served with a sprinkle of cardamom powder. 
4.2) Jalebi: Crispy, fermented batter fried in a spiral shape and served with a side of cardamom-flavored syrup. 
Drinks: 
5.1) Mango Lassi: A refreshing yogurt-based drink made with mango puree and spices, served over ice with a sprinkle of cardamom powder. 
5.2) Chai: A strong and spicy tea made with black tea, milk, and spices, served with a side of sugar and milk. 
 Menu Week 9 (February 26th - March 4th): 
As we welcome the arrival of spring, we celebrate the flavors of Italy with a focus on fresh vegetables, seafood, and Italian cheeses. 
Appetizers: 
1.1) Grilled Asparagus: Fresh asparagus grilled to perfection, served with a side of parmesan cheese and a drizzle of lemon juice. 
1.2) Bruschetta: Toasted bread rubbed with garlic and topped with diced tomatoes, basil, and mozzarella cheese, drizzled with olive oil. 
Main Courses: 
2.1) Spaghetti Carbonara: A rich and creamy pasta dish made with spaghetti, bacon, eggs, and parmesan cheese, served with a side of garlic bread.

input:
James is a chef with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on September 28), my wife (birthday on December 08), my child_1 (birthday on June 29), my child_2 (birthday on March 15), my child_3 (birthday on July 15), 
2) Family beach vacation in Maui in week 25-26.

3) Participate in a local startup pitch night every 4 weeks on weekends, starting from week 14.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for James for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

input:
Ava is a chef with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on December 17), my wife (birthday on April 06), my child_1 (birthday on November 30), my child_2 (birthday on April 29), my child_3 (birthday on December 08), 
2) Scuba diving adventure in the Great Barrier Reef in week 16-17.

3) Attend wine tasting sessions every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 12.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Ava for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

checks_range.16: Scuba diving adventure in the Great Barrier Reef

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): Celebrating New Year with Luxury and Comfort
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
Appetizers: 
- 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
- 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
Main Courses: 
- 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
- 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
Side Dishes: 
- 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
- 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
Desserts: 
- 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
- 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
Drinks: 
- 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
- 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): Winter Warmth
This week, our menu focuses on comforting dishes to ward off the chill of winter. 
Appetizers: 
- 1.1) Grilled Asparagus with Lemon Aioli: Fresh asparagus grilled to perfection, served with a zesty lemon aioli.
- 1.2) Hearty Beef Stew Meatballs: Bite-sized beef meatballs served in a rich beef broth.
Main Courses: 
- 2.1) Braised Short Ribs: Fall-off-the-bone tender short ribs slow-cooked in a full-bodied red wine sauce.
- 2.2) Pan-Seared Salmon with Herb Crust: Fresh salmon fillet seared to perfection, topped with a fragrant herb crust.
Side Dishes: 
- 3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables: A medley of carrots, parsnips, and turnips roasted until tender and caramelized.
- 3.2) Creamy Spinach and Artichoke Pasta: Tender pasta tossed in a rich and creamy spinach and artichoke sauce.
Desserts: 
- 4.1) Lemon Lavender Creme Brûlée: A rich lemon and lavender-infused custard base topped with a caramelized sugar crust.
- 4.2) Warm Apple Crisp: Fresh apples topped with a crunchy oat and brown sugar topping, served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
Drinks: 
- 5.1) Hot Chocolate: A rich and creamy hot chocolate made with dark chocolate and topped with whipped cream.
- 5.2) Mulled Wine: A warm and spicy mulled wine to accompany the cozy winter atmosphere.

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): Global Inspirations
This week, our menu takes you on a culinary journey around the world, with dishes that showcase the rich flavors and techniques of international cuisine.
Appetizers: 
- 1.1) Korean-Style BBQ Tacos: Spicy Korean-style BBQ beef served in crispy tacos with kimchi slaw.
- 1.2) Indian-Style Samosas: Crispy fried or baked samosas filled with spiced potatoes and peas.
Main Courses: 
- 2.1) Japanese Teriyaki Chicken: Grilled chicken glazed with a sweet teriyaki sauce, served with steamed rice and stir-fried vegetables.
- 2.2) Moroccan Chicken Tagine: Slow-cooked chicken in a rich and aromatic tagine sauce, served with couscous and preserved lemons.
Side Dishes: 
- 3.1) Saffron Rice: Fragrant saffron-infused rice pilaf.
- 3.2) Grilled Halloumi Cheese: Cypriot-style grilled halloumi cheese served with a side of fig chutney.
Desserts: 
- 4.1) Mochi Ice Cream: Japanese-style ice cream sandwiched between soft and chewy mochi.
- 4.2) Baklava: Layered pastry filled with nuts and honey, served with a dollop of whipped cream.
Drinks: 
- 5.1) Sake: Japanese rice wine perfect for pairing with sushi and sashimi.
- 5.2) Mint Tea: Refreshing mint tea to accompany the Indian-inspired dishes.

 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): Winter Comfort
This week, our menu focuses on warm and comforting dishes to soothe the soul.
Appetizers: 
- 1.1) Roasted Butternut Squash Soup: Creamy soup made with roasted butternut squash and topped with crispy bacon.
- 1.2) Fried Green Tomatoes: Thinly sliced green tomatoes fried until crispy, served with a remoulade sauce.
Main Courses: 
- 2.1) Beef Stroganoff: Tender beef strips sautéed in a creamy mushroom sauce, served with egg noodles.
- 2.2) Chicken and Mushroom Crepes: Thin French crepes filled with a rich chicken and mushroom filling, topped with a creamy bechamel sauce.
Side Dishes: 
- 3.1) Creamy Mashed Sweet Potatoes: Sweet potatoes mashed with butter, milk, and a hint of nutmeg.
- 3.2) Braised Red Cabbage: Red cabbage slow-cooked in a sweet and tangy apple cider vinegar sauce.
Desserts: 
- 4.1) Chocolate Peanut Butter Tart: Rich chocolate tart filled with a creamy peanut butter filling.
- 4.2) Spiced Apple Crumble: Fresh apples topped with a crunchy oat and brown sugar topping, served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
Drinks: 
- 5.1) Hot Tea: A selection of hot teas, including English breakfast, earl grey, and herbal infusions.
- 5.2) Spiced Cider: Warm and spicy cider made with apple juice and a hint of cinnamon.

 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th): Squash and Pumpkin Delights
This week, we celebrate the bounty of winter squash and pumpkin.
Appetizers: 
- 1.1) Roasted Butternut Squash Dip: Creamy dip made with roasted butternut squash and served with crispy pita chips.
- 1.2) Grilled Pumpkin Fritters: Thinly sliced pumpkin grilled until crispy, served with a dollop of sour cream.
Main Courses: 
- 2.1) Pumpkin Ravioli: Delicate pasta filled with a rich pumpkin and sage filling, served with a brown butter and sage sauce.
- 2.2) Squash and Apple Tart: Thinly sliced squash and apples layered in a flaky pastry crust, topped with a crumbly oat and brown sugar topping.
Side Dishes: 
- 3.1) Sautéed Greens: Quick-sauteed greens, such as kale or spinach, tossed with garlic and lemon.
- 3.2) Roasted Carrots: Carrots roasted until tender and caramelized, tossed with a hint of cumin.
Desserts: 
- 4.1) Pumpkin Pie: Classic pumpkin pie made with a flaky crust and topped with whipped cream.
- 4.2) Squash and Ginger Cake: Moist cake made with roasted squash and ginger, topped with a cream cheese frosting.
Drinks: 
- 5.1) Spiced Cider: Warm and spicy cider made with apple juice and a hint of cinnamon.
- 5.2) Herbal Tea: A selection of herbal teas, including chamomile, peppermint, and lemon balm.

- 1.2) Heirloom Tomato Bruschetta: Fresh heirloom tomatoes atop toasted bread with basil and mozzarella.

- 2.1) Beef Wellington: Tender filet mignon wrapped in puff pastry, served with a rich red wine sauce.

- 3.1) Roasted Asparagus: Asparagus roasted until tender, tossed with lemon and parmesan cheese.

Desserts: 
- 4.1) Chocolate-Covered Strawberries: Fresh strawberries dipped in rich dark chocolate.

Drinks: 
- 5.1) Champagne: Bubbly champagne to toast the love and romance.
- 5.2) Love Potion Cocktail: A sweet and fruity cocktail made with rose-infused vodka, lemon juice, and sparkling wine.

input:
Liam is a photographer with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on November 30), my wife (birthday on September 27), my child_1 (birthday on May 07), my child_2 (birthday on May 19), my child_3 (birthday on May 11), 
2) Participating in a surfing camp in Hawaii in week 48-49.

3) Join a cycling club for group rides every 3 weeks on weekends, starting from week 17.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Liam for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
