output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
This week's menu offers a lighter twist on our usual fare, focusing on seasonal ingredients and bold flavors. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Heirloom Tomato Salad: Fresh heirloom tomatoes mixed with burrata cheese, basil, and balsamic glaze. 
1.2) Pan-Seared Scallops: Succulent scallops seared to perfection, served with a citrus-herb butter. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Grilled Filet Mignon: Tender filet mignon grilled to desired doneness, served with a cabernet reduction. 
2.2) Pan-Seared Salmon: Fresh salmon cooked to perfection, served with a lemon-dill sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Asparagus: Asparagus roasted to tender perfection, finished with a drizzle of olive oil. 
3.2) Sautéed Spinach: Fresh spinach cooked with garlic and lemon, served hot. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Lemon Lavender Creme Brûlée: A rich lemon custard base topped with a layer of caramelized lavender sugar. 
4.2) Fresh Fruit Tart: A sweet and tangy mix of seasonal fruits atop a buttery pastry crust. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fresh Juices: A selection of freshly squeezed juices, from orange to beetroot. 
5.2) Iced Tea: A refreshing brew of herbal tea served over ice.

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
This week's menu celebrates the richness of the winter season, with comforting dishes that warm the heart and soul. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Truffle Soup: Creamy soup infused with the deep flavor of truffles, served with crusty bread. 
1.2) Roasted Sweet Potato Skins: Sweet potato skins roasted with herbs and spices, served with a dollop of sour cream. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Braised Short Ribs: Fall-off-the-bone tender short ribs slow-cooked in a rich red wine sauce. 
2.2) Pan-Seared Duck Breast: Seared duck breast served with a cherry compote and wild rice. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Creamy Polenta: Smooth polenta cooked with Parmesan and cream, served with a sprinkle of parsley. 
3.2) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Brussels sprouts roasted with bacon and balsamic glaze, served hot. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Lava Cake: Warm, gooey chocolate cake served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. 
4.2) Apple Crisp: A classic dessert of tender apples topped with a crunchy oat and butter crumble. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Mulled Wine: A rich, spiced wine served warm and comforting. 
5.2) Hot Chocolate: A decadent hot chocolate topped with whipped cream and chocolate shavings.

 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
This week's menu takes a culinary journey around the world, featuring flavors and ingredients from far-flung destinations. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Japanese Spring Rolls: Crispy spring rolls filled with shrimp, vegetables, and herbs, served with a sweet soy sauce. 
1.2) Indian Samosas: Crispy samosas filled with spiced potatoes and peas, served with a cilantro chutney. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Korean BBQ Beef: Marinated beef short ribs grilled to perfection, served with a side of kimchi. 
2.2) Moroccan Chicken Tagine: Chicken cooked in a rich and aromatic spice blend, served with couscous and preserved lemons. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Saffron Rice: Fragrant saffron-infused rice served with a sprinkle of toasted almonds. 
3.2) Roasted Cauliflower: Cauliflower roasted with harissa and pine nuts, served hot. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Mochi Ice Cream: A sweet and creamy ice cream wrapped in soft mochi dough, flavored with green tea or mango. 
4.2) Baklava: A classic Middle Eastern dessert of layers of phyllo, nuts, and honey. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Sake: A selection of premium sake to pair with the Asian-inspired menu. 
5.2) Mint Tea: A refreshing brew of mint tea served over ice.

 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th): 
This week's menu highlights the freshness of the season with seafood dishes that showcase the best of the ocean's bounty. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Grilled Octopus: Tender and charred octopus served with a zesty lemon-herb sauce. 
1.2) Steamed Mussels: Fresh mussels steamed in a flavorful white wine broth, served with crusty bread. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Pan-Seared Halibut: Fresh halibut seared to perfection, served with a light and citrusy sauce. 
2.2) Grilled Salmon: Fresh salmon grilled to desired doneness, served with a dill-cream sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Sautéed Spinach: Fresh spinach cooked with garlic and lemon, served hot. 
3.2) Roasted Asparagus: Asparagus roasted to tender perfection, finished with a drizzle of olive oil. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Lemon Lavender Panna Cotta: A creamy and refreshing panna cotta topped with a layer of caramelized lavender sugar. 
4.2) Fresh Fruit Tart: A sweet and tangy mix of seasonal fruits atop a buttery pastry crust. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fresh Juices: A selection of freshly squeezed juices, from orange to beetroot. 
5.2) Iced Tea: A refreshing brew of herbal tea served over ice.

 Menu Week 6 (February 5th - February 11th): 
This week's menu explores the comfort of home cooking, with hearty dishes that warm the heart and soul. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Tomato Soup: A rich and comforting soup made with fresh tomatoes and a touch of cream. 
1.2) Roasted Sweet Potato Fries: Sweet potato fries roasted with herbs and spices, served with a side of spicy mayo. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Braised Beef Stew: Tender beef slow-cooked in a rich and flavorful stew, served with crusty bread. 
2.2) Pan-Seared Pork Chops: Thick pork chops seared to perfection, served with a sweet and tangy apple sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Brussels sprouts roasted with bacon and balsamic glaze, served hot. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Apple Crisp: A classic dessert of tender apples topped with a crunchy oat and butter crumble. 
4.2) Chocolate Chip Cookies: Warm, gooey cookies served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Hot Chocolate: A decadent hot chocolate topped with whipped cream and chocolate shavings. 
5.2) Fresh Lemonade: A refreshing and tangy lemonade made with real sugar and fresh lemons.

 Menu Week 7 (February 12th - February 18th): 
This week's menu takes inspiration from the rich flavors of Italy, with dishes that showcase the beauty of Italian cuisine. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Bruschetta: Toasted bread rubbed with garlic and topped with diced tomatoes and basil. 
1.2) Caprese Salad: Fresh mozzarella, tomato, and basil salad dressed with extra-virgin olive oil. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Spaghetti Bolognese: Classic spaghetti dish cooked with ground beef and a rich tomato sauce. 
2.2) Chicken Parmesan: Breaded and fried chicken topped with melted mozzarella and marinara sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic and Herb Roasted Potatoes: Potatoes roasted with garlic and herbs, served hot. 
3.2) Sautéed Broccoli: Fresh broccoli cooked with garlic and lemon, served hot. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert of ladyfingers soaked in coffee and liqueur, layered with mascarpone cheese. 
4.2) Panna Cotta: Creamy panna cotta topped with a mixed berry compote. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Pinot Grigio: A crisp and refreshing white wine to pair with the Italian-inspired menu. 
5.2) Limone Spritz: A refreshing mix of lemon-lime soda and Prosecco, garnished with a lemon slice.

 Menu Week 8 (February 19th - February 25th): 
This week's menu focuses on the bold flavors of the Middle East, with dishes that showcase the rich history of this ancient region. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Falafel: Crispy and flavorful falafel served with a side of tahini sauce. 
1.2) Baba Ghanoush: Smoky eggplant dip made with roasted eggplant, tahini, and lemon juice. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Shawarma: Juicy lamb or chicken served in a warm pita with pickles and tahini sauce. 
2.2) Chicken Kebabs: Marinated chicken skewers grilled to perfection, served with a side of rice and vegetables. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Couscous: Light and fluffy couscous served with a sprinkle of parsley and lemon. 
3.2) Roasted Carrots: Carrots roasted with cumin and coriander, served hot. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Baklava: A classic dessert of layers of phyllo, nuts, and honey. 
4.2) Rosewater Panna Cotta: Creamy panna cotta infused with the delicate flavor of rosewater. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Turkish Coffee: A rich and bold coffee made with finely ground coffee beans. 
5.2) Mint Tea: A refreshing brew of mint tea served over ice.

 Menu Week 9 (February 26th - March 4th): 
This week's menu takes inspiration from the vibrant colors and flavors of Mexico, with dishes that showcase the bold spirit of this beautiful country. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Guacamole: Fresh and creamy guacamole made with ripe avocados and lime juice. 
1.2) Grilled Corn with Cotija Cheese: Fresh corn grilled with cotija cheese, chili powder, and lime juice. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Chicken Fajitas: Sizzling chicken strips cooked with peppers, onions, and spices, served with warm flour tortillas. 
2.2) Carnitas: Slow-cooked pork shoulder shredded and fried until crispy, served with a side of salsa and sour cream. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Mexican Street Corn: Grilled corn on the cob slathered with butter, mayonnaise, and cotija cheese. 
3.2) Sautéed Black Beans: Fresh black beans cooked with onions, garlic, and cumin, served hot. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Churros: Crunchy churros served with a side of rich chocolate sauce. 
4.2) Tres Leches Cake: Moist sponge cake soaked in a mixture of evaporated milk, condensed milk, and heavy cream. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Agua Fresca: A refreshing drink made with watermelon or hibiscus, served over ice. 
5.2) Margarita: A classic cocktail of tequila, lime juice, and triple sec, served in a salt-rimmed glass.

 Menu Week 10 (March 5th - March 11th): 
This week's menu takes inspiration from the ancient cuisine of Greece, with dishes that showcase the simple yet elegant flavors of this beautiful country. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Greek Salad: A classic salad of tomatoes, cucumbers, red onions, feta cheese, and olives, dressed with extra-virgin olive oil. 
1.2) Grilled Octopus: Tender and charred octopus served with a squeeze of lemon and a sprinkle of oregano. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Grilled Lamb Chops: Tender and flavorful lamb chops grilled to perfection, served with a side of roasted potatoes and steamed vegetables. 
2.2) Chicken Souvlaki: Marinated chicken skewers grilled to perfection, served with a side of tangy tzatziki sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Potatoes: Potatoes roasted with rosemary and lemon, served hot. 
3.2) Sautéed Spinach: Fresh spinach cooked with garlic and lemon, served hot. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Galaktoboureko: A classic Greek dessert of custard pie wrapped in flaky phyllo, topped with a sweet syrup. 
4.2) Baklava: A classic dessert of layers of phyllo, nuts, and honey. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Ouzo Spritz: A refreshing mix of ouzo, lemon-lime soda, and a splash of orange juice, served over ice. 
5.2) Greek Coffee: A strong and bold coffee made with finely ground coffee beans and served in a small cup.

 Menu Week 11 (March 12th - March 18th): 
This week's menu takes inspiration from the bold flavors of India, with dishes that showcase the rich and spicy spirit of this beautiful country. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Samosas: Crispy and flavorful samosas served with a side of tamarind chutney. 
1.2) Onion Bhajis: Crispy onion fritters served with a side of mint chutney. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Chicken Tikka Masala: Marinated chicken cooked in a rich and creamy tomato sauce, served with a side of basmati rice and naan bread. 
2.2) Beef Korma: Tender beef cooked in a mild and creamy sauce, served with a side of basmati rice and naan bread. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Basmati Rice: Fragrant and fluffy basmati rice served with a sprinkle of saffron and cardamom. 
3.2) Sautéed Spinach: Fresh spinach cooked with garlic and lemon, served hot. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Gulab Jamun: Deep-fried dumplings soaked in a sweet and fragrant syrup, served with a sprinkle of cardamom. 
4.2) Kulfi: Indian-style ice cream flavored with cardamom, saffron, or rosewater. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Mango Lassi: A refreshing drink made with yogurt, mango puree, and a splash of milk, served over ice. 
5.2) Chai: A spiced tea made with black tea, milk, and a blend of warming spices, served in a small cup.

 Menu Week 12 (March 19th - March 25th): 
This week's menu takes inspiration from the rich flavors of Morocco, with dishes that showcase the bold and aromatic spirit of this beautiful country. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) B'stilla: A savory pastry filled with layers of spices, onions, and meat, served with a side of preserved lemon. 
1.2) Chakchouka: A spicy and flavorful stew made with bell peppers, onions, and tomatoes, served with a side of crusty bread. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Chicken Tagine: Marinated chicken cooked in a rich and aromatic sauce, served with a side of couscous and preserved lemon. 
2.2) Lamb Kebabs: Tender lamb skewers grilled to perfection, served with a side of spicy harissa sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Couscous: Light and fluffy couscous served with a sprinkle of parsley and lemon. 
3.2) Sautéed Carrots: Carrots sautéed with cumin and coriander, served hot. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Baklava: A classic dessert of layers of phyllo, nuts, and honey. 
4.2) Moroccan Crepes: Thin and delicate crepes filled with a sweet and fragrant mixture of honey, sugar, and spices. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Mint Tea: A refreshing brew made with fresh mint, green tea, and a splash of honey, served over ice. 
5.2) Orange Juice: A sweet and tangy juice made with freshly squeezed oranges, served over ice.

 Menu Week 13 (March 26th - April 1st): 
This week's menu takes inspiration from the rich flavors of Thailand, with dishes that showcase the bold and aromatic spirit of this beautiful country. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Spring Rolls: Crispy and flavorful spring rolls filled with shrimp, vegetables, and herbs, served with a side of sweet chili sauce. 
1.2) Tom Yum Soup: A spicy and sour soup made with lemongrass, lime leaves, and mushrooms, served with a side of steamed rice. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Green Curry: A creamy and aromatic curry made with green chilies, coconut milk, and your choice of protein, served with a side of steamed rice. 
2.2) Massaman Curry: A rich and slightly sweet curry made with beef or chicken, potatoes, and peanuts, served with a side of steamed rice. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Steamed Rice: Fragrant and fluffy steamed rice served with a sprinkle of toasted peanuts. 
3.2) Sautéed Thai Basil: Thai basil sautéed with garlic and chilies, served hot. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Coconut Ice Cream: A creamy and sweet ice cream made with coconut milk and a touch of lime juice. 
4.2) Mango Sticky Rice: Sweet and fragrant sticky rice served with a side of fresh mango slices. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Singha Beer: A crisp and refreshing beer made with rice and a hint of citrus, served chilled. 
5.2) Thai Iced Tea: A sweet and creamy tea made with black tea, milk, and a splash of sugar, served over ice.

 Menu Week 14 (April 2nd - April 8th): 
This week's menu takes inspiration from the rich flavors of Japan, with dishes that showcase the bold and delicate spirit of this beautiful country. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Edamame: Boiled and salted soybeans served with a side of dipping sauce. 
1.2) Gyoza: Pan-fried dumplings filled with pork and vegetables, served with a side of soy sauce and wasabi. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Sushi: Fresh and delicate sushi rolls made with vinegared rice and your choice of fillings, served with a side of wasabi and soy sauce. 
2.2) Ramen: A rich and savory noodle soup made with pork or chicken broth, served with a side of spring onions and sesame seeds. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Steamed Rice: Fragrant and fluffy steamed rice served with a sprinkle of toasted sesame seeds. 
3.2) Sautéed Bok Choy: Bok choy sautéed with garlic and ginger, served hot. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Mochi: Soft and chewy mochi filled with sweet fillings such as red bean paste or ice cream. 
4.2) Matcha Ice Cream: A bright and refreshing ice cream made with matcha powder and a touch of sugar. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Sake: A crisp and refreshing sake made with rice and a hint of citrus, served chilled. 
5.2) Green Tea: A delicate and refreshing green tea made with Matcha powder and a touch of sugar, served over ice.

 Menu Week 15 (April 9th - April 15th): 
This week's menu takes inspiration from the rich flavors of Italy, with dishes that showcase the bold and elegant spirit of this beautiful country. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Bruschetta: Grilled bread rubbed with garlic and topped with diced tomatoes, basil, and mozzarella cheese. 
1.2) Prosciutto-Wrapped Melon: Thin slices of prosciutto wrapped around fresh melon, served with a side of honey. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Spaghetti Bolognese: A rich and meaty pasta dish made with ground beef, pork, and tomatoes, served with a side of garlic bread. 
2.2) Chicken Parmesan: Breaded and fried chicken topped with marinara sauce and melted mozzarella cheese, served with a side of spaghetti. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Bread: Crusty bread rubbed with garlic and topped with butter and parmesan cheese. 
3.2) Sauteed Spinach: Fresh spinach sautéed with garlic and lemon, served hot. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Tiramisu: A classic Italian dessert made with ladyfingers, mascarpone cheese, and espresso. 
4.2) Panna Cotta: A creamy and sweet dessert made with cream, sugar, and vanilla, topped with a mixed berry compote. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Pinot Grigio: A crisp and refreshing white wine made with Pinot Grigio grapes, served chilled. 
5.2) Espresso: A strong and bold coffee made with roasted coffee beans, served in a small cup.

 Menu Week 16 (April 16th - April 22nd): 
This week's menu takes inspiration from the rich flavors of China, with dishes that showcase the bold and delicate spirit of this beautiful country. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Dumplings: Pan-fried or steamed dumplings filled with pork, vegetables, and herbs, served with a side of soy sauce. 
1.2) Wonton Soup: A light and savory soup made with wontons, vegetables, and a touch of soy sauce, served with a side of steamed rice. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Kung Pao Chicken: A spicy and savory dish made with chicken, peanuts, vegetables, and chili peppers, served with a side of steamed rice. 
2.2) Beef and Broccoli: A classic Chinese dish made with beef, broccoli, and a savory sauce, served with a side of steamed rice. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Steamed Rice: Fragrant and fluffy steamed rice served with a sprinkle of toasted sesame seeds. 
3.2) Sautéed Bok Choy: Bok choy sautéed with garlic and ginger, served hot. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Almond Cookies: Crispy and sweet cookies made with almond flour and a touch of sugar. 
4.2) Mango Pudding: A creamy and sweet dessert made with mango puree, sugar, and a touch of coconut milk. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Jasmine Tea: A delicate and fragrant tea made with jasmine flowers and green tea leaves, served over ice. 
5.2) Chinese Beer: A crisp and refreshing beer made with rice or barley, served chilled.

 Menu Week 17 (April 23rd - April 29th): 
This week's menu takes inspiration from the rich flavors of India, with dishes that showcase the bold and aromatic spirit of this beautiful country. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Samosas: Crispy and flavorful samosas filled with potatoes, peas, and spices, served with a side of chutney. 
1.2) Papri Chaat: A savory and spicy snack made with boiled potatoes, chickpeas, and tamarind chutney, served with a side of crispy bread. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Chicken Tikka Masala: A rich and creamy dish made with marinated chicken, yogurt, and spices, served with a side of basmati rice and naan bread. 
2.2) Palak Paneer: A creamy and savory dish made with spinach, paneer cheese, and a touch of spice, served with a side of steamed rice and naan bread. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Basmati Rice: Fragrant and fluffy basmati rice served with a sprinkle of toasted cumin seeds. 
3.2) Sautéed Spinach: Fresh spinach sautéed with garlic and ginger, served hot. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Gulab Jamun: Deep-fried dumplings soaked in a sweet and fragrant syrup, served with a side of cardamom pods. 
4.2) Kulfi: Indian-style ice cream flavored with cardamom, saffron, or rosewater. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Mango Lassi: A sweet and creamy drink made with yogurt, mango puree, and a touch of cumin. 
5.2) Chai: A spiced tea made with black tea, milk, and a blend of spices, served in a small cup.

 Menu Week 18 (April 30th - May 6th): 
This week's menu takes inspiration from the rich flavors of Korea, with dishes that showcase the bold and spicy spirit of this beautiful country. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Kimchi: Spicy and sour fermented Korean cabbage, served with a side of steamed rice. 
1.2) Japchae: Stir-fried glass noodles made with sweet potato starch, vegetables, and a touch of sesame oil, served with a side of steamed rice. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Bibimbap: A rice bowl dish topped with an assortment of vegetables, meat (usually beef), and a fried egg, served with a side of spicy chili pepper paste. 
2.2) Bulgogi: A marinated beef dish made with soy sauce, sugar, garlic, and sesame oil, served with a side of steamed rice and kimchi. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Steamed Rice: Fragrant and fluffy steamed rice served with a sprinkle of toasted sesame seeds. 
3.2) Sautéed Zucchini: Zucchini sautéed with garlic and ginger, served hot. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Patbingsu: A sweet and refreshing dessert made with shaved ice, sweet red bean paste, and mochi, served with a side of sesame seeds. 
4.2) Tteok: A sweet and chewy rice cake made with glutinous rice flour and a touch of sugar, served with a side of sesame seeds. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Makgeolli: A traditional Korean rice wine made with fermented rice and water, served in a small bowl. 
5.2) Gimbap Tea: A sweet and refreshing tea made with ginseng, green tea leaves, and a touch of honey.

 Menu Week 19 (May 7th - May 13th): 
This week's menu takes inspiration from the rich flavors of Southeast Asia, with dishes that showcase the bold and aromatic spirit of this beautiful region. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Spring Rolls: Crispy and flavorful spring rolls filled with shrimp, vegetables, and a touch of coconut milk, served with a side of sweet chili sauce. 
1.2) Satay: Grilled meat skewers made with chicken, beef, or pork, served with a side of peanut sauce and steamed rice. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Pad Thai: A stir-fried noodle dish made with rice noodles, shrimp, tofu, and a sweet and sour sauce, served with a side of steamed rice. 
2.2) Massaman Curry: A rich and slightly sweet curry made with beef or chicken, potatoes, and a blend of spices, served with a side of steamed rice and naan bread. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Steamed Rice: Fragrant and fluffy steamed rice served with a sprinkle of toasted coconut flakes. 
3.2) Sautéed Eggplant: Eggplant sautéed with garlic and ginger, served hot. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Mango Sticky Rice: A sweet and fragrant dessert made with glutinous rice, mango puree, and a touch of coconut milk. 
4.2) Coconut Ice Cream: A creamy and refreshing ice cream made with coconut milk, sugar, and a touch of salt, served with a side of toasted coconut flakes. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Singha Beer: A crisp and refreshing beer made with rice and a blend of spices, served chilled. 
5.2) Thai Iced Tea: A sweet and creamy tea made with black tea, milk, sugar, and a touch of vanilla, served over ice.

 Menu Week 20 (May 14th - May 20th): 
This week's menu takes inspiration from the rich flavors of Middle Eastern cuisine, with dishes that showcase the bold and aromatic spirit of this beautiful region. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Falafel: Crispy and flavorful chickpea patties served with a side of tahini sauce and steamed pita bread. 
1.2) Hummus: A creamy and savory dip made with chickpeas, tahini, garlic, and lemon juice, served with a side of pita bread and vegetables. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Shish Taouk: A marinated chicken dish made with olive oil, garlic, and a blend of spices, served with a side of steamed rice and grilled vegetables. 
2.2) Lamb Kofta: A flavorful lamb dish made with minced meat, spices, and a touch of olive oil, served with a side of steamed rice and grilled vegetables. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Steamed Rice: Fragrant and fluffy steamed rice served with a sprinkle of toasted cumin seeds. 
3.2) Sautéed Spinach: Spinach sautéed with garlic and lemon juice, served hot. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Baklava: A sweet and crunchy pastry made with layers of phyllo dough, nuts, and honey, served with a side of rose water and cardamom. 
4.2) Kulfi: Indian-style ice cream flavored with cardamom, saffron, or rosewater. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Turkish Coffee: A strong and rich coffee made with finely ground coffee beans and a touch of sugar, served in a small cup. 
5.2) Mint Lemonade: A refreshing and tangy drink made with fresh mint leaves, lemon juice, and a touch of sugar, served over ice.

 Menu Week 21 (May 21st - May 27th): 
This week's menu takes inspiration from the rich flavors of Latin American cuisine, with dishes that showcase the bold and vibrant spirit of this beautiful region. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Empanadas: Crispy and flavorful pastry pockets filled with beef, chicken, or cheese, served with a side of salsa and steamed rice. 
1.2) Queso Fundido: A melted cheese dip made with melted cheese, chorizo, and a touch of cumin, served with a side of steamed tortillas and vegetables. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Carnitas: A slow-cooked pork dish made with lard, spices, and a touch of orange juice, served with a side of steamed rice, beans, and tortillas. 
2.2) Churrasco: A grilled skirt steak made with olive oil, garlic, and a blend of spices, served with a side of steamed rice, beans, and grilled vegetables. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Steamed Rice: Fragrant and fluffy steamed rice served with a sprinkle of toasted cumin seeds. 
3.2) Sautéed Plantains: Plantains sautéed with garlic and a touch of cumin, served hot. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Tres Leches Cake: A moist and creamy sponge cake made with three types of milk, sugar, and a touch of vanilla, served with a side of whipped cream and toasted coconut flakes. 
4.2) Churros: Crunchy and sweet fried dough pastry sticks coated in cinnamon sugar, served with a side of chocolate dipping sauce. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Cerveza: A crisp and refreshing beer made with hops, malt, and a touch of sugar, served chilled. 
5.2) Fresh Fruit Juice: A refreshing and tangy drink made with fresh fruit, sugar, and a touch of water, served over ice.

 Menu Week 22 (May 28th - June 3rd): 
This week's menu takes inspiration from the rich flavors of Greek cuisine, with dishes that showcase the bold and savory spirit of this beautiful country. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Grilled Octopus: A char-grilled octopus dish made with olive oil, garlic, and a blend of spices, served with a side of lemon wedges and steamed rice. 
1.2) Spanakopita: A savory pastry filled with spinach, feta cheese, and a touch of nutmeg, served with a side of steamed rice and a dollop of tzatziki sauce. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Gyro: A classic Greek sandwich made with juicy lamb or beef, topped with tomato, onion, cucumber, and a dollop of tzatziki sauce, served in a warm pita bread. 
2.2) Moussaka: A rich and savory layered dish made with eggplant, ground beef, and a creamy bechamel sauce, served with a side of steamed rice and a sprinkle of parmesan cheese. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Steamed Rice: Fragrant and fluffy steamed rice served with a sprinkle of toasted oregano. 
3.2) Sautéed Zucchini: Zucchini sautéed with garlic and a touch of lemon juice, served hot. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Baklava: A sweet and crunchy pastry made with layers of phyllo dough, nuts, and honey, served with a side of rose water and cardamom. 
4.2) Greek Yogurt with Honey: A creamy and sweet dessert made with Greek yogurt, honey, and a touch of vanilla, served with a side of toasted almonds and a sprinkle of cinnamon. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Ouzo: A strong and anise-flavored spirit made with grapes, served chilled and mixed with water.

input:
Noah is a journalist with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on January 19), my wife (birthday on March 22), my child_1 (birthday on May 03), my child_2 (birthday on January 09), my child_3 (birthday on January 29), 
2) Participating in a martial arts training camp in China in week 11-12.

3) Attend fitness bootcamps in the park every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 15.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Noah for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

William is a economist with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 26), my wife (birthday on August 02), my child_1 (birthday on April 27), my child_2 (birthday on August 17), my father (birthday on January 03), 
2) Joining a culinary tour focused on Mexican cuisine in week 44-45.

3) Attend fitness bootcamps in the park every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 14.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for William for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

Isabella is a biologist with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on July 07), my wife (birthday on May 29), my child_1 (birthday on March 31), my child_2 (birthday on December 28), my father (birthday on December 27), 
2) Family camping and star-gazing in the Australian Outback in week 44-45.

3) Visit the farmers market for fresh produce every 4 weeks on weekends, starting from week 11.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Isabella for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.

5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

input:
Emma is a architect with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on August 18), my wife (birthday on June 21), my child_1 (birthday on May 03), my child_2 (birthday on April 12), my child_3 (birthday on September 08), 
2) Attending a chess camp for kids and adults in week 33-34.

3) Participate in weekend chess tournaments every 3 weeks on weekends, starting from week 17.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Emma for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

input:
Olivia is a nurse with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on September 19), my wife (birthday on April 13), my child_1 (birthday on July 21), my father (birthday on June 27), my mother (birthday on September 28), 
2) Participating in a surfing camp in Hawaii in week 39-40.

3) Participate in a writers' workshop every 3 weeks on weekends, starting from week 19.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Olivia for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

checks_range.39: Participating in a surfing camp in Hawaii

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden.
2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce.
3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze.
4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.
5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.

Emma is a chef with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on November 22), my wife (birthday on February 21), my child_1 (birthday on June 17), my child_2 (birthday on October 21), my child_3 (birthday on March 28), 
2) Week-long road trip across the Pacific Coast Highway in week 28-29.

3) Participate in a community clean-up day every 4 weeks on weekends, starting from week 11.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Emma for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

Emma is a biologist with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on August 03), my wife (birthday on November 22), my child_1 (birthday on May 25), my child_2 (birthday on September 03), my child_3 (birthday on April 21), 
2) Attending a fashion week in Paris in week 34-35.

3) Join a scuba diving club for local expeditions every 3 weeks on weekends, starting from week 18.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)

Emma is a artist with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on November 10), my wife (birthday on August 17), my child_1 (birthday on April 05), my father (birthday on December 26), my mother (birthday on March 03), 
2) Participating in an ice fishing adventure in Finland in week 43-44.

3) Go bird watching in local parks every 4 weeks on weekends, starting from week 11.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Emma for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

input:
Ava is a architect with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on October 31), my wife (birthday on June 07), my child_1 (birthday on August 05), my father (birthday on July 14), my mother (birthday on September 29), 
2) Visiting national parks during a wildlife migration season in week 10-11.

3) Join a local amateur astronomy club every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 13.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Ava for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

Sophia is a photographer with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on April 22), my wife (birthday on March 27), my child_1 (birthday on April 10), my father (birthday on March 28), my mother (birthday on December 10), 
2) Participating in a martial arts training camp in China in week 7-8.

3) Join a karaoke night at a local bar every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 12.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Sophia for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

input:
Sophia is a journalist with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on June 06), my wife (birthday on November 22), my child_1 (birthday on August 31), my father (birthday on January 22), my mother (birthday on May 11), 
2) Skiing holiday in Aspen in week 21-22.

3) Participate in a community clean-up day every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 16.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Sophia for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

Noah is a artist with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on November 04), my wife (birthday on October 06), my child_1 (birthday on January 30), my child_2 (birthday on March 07), my father (birthday on September 02), 
2) Skiing holiday in Aspen in week 48-49.

3) Attend a parenting workshop every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 19.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Noah for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

input:
James is a chef with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on April 11), my wife (birthday on February 07), my child_1 (birthday on February 03), my child_2 (birthday on May 11), my father (birthday on October 04), 
2) Participating in a week-long film production workshop in week 18-19.

3) Visit historic sites in the area every 4 weeks on weekends, starting from week 16.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. Liam is a engineer with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on November 02), my wife (birthday on December 31), my child_1 (birthday on April 02), my child_2 (birthday on April 26), my child_3 (birthday on March 09), 
2) Attending a chess camp for kids and adults in week 31-32.

3) Participate in a photography club every 4 weeks on weekends, starting from week 13.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Liam for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

checks_range.31: Attending a chess camp for kids and adults
checks_range.32: Attending a chess camp for kids and adults

input:
Isabella is a architect with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on November 03), my wife (birthday on November 07), my child_1 (birthday on May 28), my child_2 (birthday on February 14), my father (birthday on September 19), 
2) Visiting national parks during a wildlife migration season in week 27-28.

3) Join a weekend hiking group every 4 weeks on weekends, starting from week 10.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Isabella for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
